tag: html body text div div div h3 span
content: CANCEL RETURNED CIS24 VOUCHERS ON CIS SYSTEM

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: This action guide explains the steps you should take to recordCIS24 vouchers surrendered to the Revenue as cancelled on the CISsystem.

tag: html body text div div div h3 span
content: CAUTION

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: Remember that changing the status of the returned vouchers from'Valid' will mean that they are treated by the CIS System as havingbeen 'used'. As a result, subject to the 'Minimum Stock Level'being reached, this action may trigger the replenishment processand a further issue of vouchers. Because of this you should alwaysbear in mind the reason for voucher cancellation and amend thesubcontractor's details or Voucher Profile Band in order to preventthe automatic issue of further vouchers either in error or bearingincorrect details.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: The action guide is presented in two parts as follows

tag: html body text div div div ul li span
content: To cancel individual vouchers, follow thesteps at A below

tag: html body text div div div ul li span
content: To cancel a range of vouchers, follow thesteps at B below

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: For physical cancellation of the vouchers, see the action guidelisted in the menu.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: A. CANCEL INDIVIDUAL VOUCHERS

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 1) Select `File' from the CIS Main Menu.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 2) Select `Manage Vouchers' from the File Menu

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 3) Select `Single voucher' from the Manage Vouchers menu

tag: html body text div div div blockquote p span
content: You should now be at the `Voucher Serial Number' window.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 4) Key in the voucher serial number for the voucher you want tocancel and click on the [OK] button

tag: html body text div div div blockquote p span
content: You should now be at the `View Voucher Details' window.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 5) Click on the [Cancel Voucher] button.

tag: html body text div div div blockquote p span
content: This should take you to the `Voucher Cancellation' window.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 6) Click on the 'Status' field to reveal a list of threepossible statuses to change to

tag: html body text div div div div ul li span
content: lost

tag: html body text div div div div ul li span
content: stolen

tag: html body text div div div div ul li span
content: spoilt

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 7) Click on 'Spoilt' (or other option). It should then appearalone in the box.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 8) Click on the `Effective From' box and key in the date ofreceipt of the voucher.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 9) Select the 'Reason for Cancellation' from the listprovided. This action will enable the [Save] button.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 10) Click on the [Save] button to store the change.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 11) This action will result in the display of a final warningmessage confirming that the change of status is irreversible

tag: html body text div div div div ul li span
content: Click on [Yes] to receive the message 'This changehas been saved and the voucher will be cancelled overnight'.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: The overnight batch process will update all the voucher andstock on hand records. This will have the effect of reducing theminimum stock level of vouchers held by the contractor and, unlessthere is a system stop on voucher issue, trigger automaticreplenishment.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: B. CANCEL A RANGE OF VOUCHERS

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 1) Select `File' from the CIS Main Menu.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 2) Select `Manage Vouchers' from the File Menu.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 3) Select `Range of Vouchers' from the Manage Vouchers menu

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: The `Taxpayer UTR/NINO' window should now be displayed.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 4) For a sole trader or cardholder for a concern, enter theNINO or UTR. For a concern, enter the UTR of the concern.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 5) Click on [OK]

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: If the subcontractor also acts as a contractor, you should beat the `Contractor/subcontractor Selection' window. Click on the[Subcontractor] button.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: If the subcontractor is a concern with more than onecardholder, you will be presented with the `Cardholder Selection'window. Click on the cardholder to whom the vouchers were issuedand click on the [OK] button.

tag: html body text div div div blockquote p span
content: You should now be at the `Voucher selection criteria'window.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 6) Click on the CIS24 box in the `Select Voucher Type' area ofthe window and select the 'Y' by clicking on it.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 7) Click on the [View Vouchers] button

tag: html body text div div div blockquote p span
content: You should now see the `List Voucher Ranges' window containing alist of ranges of vouchers issued to the subcontractor.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 8) Click on the entry in the list for the vouchers you want tocancel and click on the [Cancel Range] button.

tag: html body text div div div blockquote p span
content: This should take you to the `Voucher Cancellation' window.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 9) Click on the 'Status' field to reveal a list of threepossible statuses to change to

tag: html body text div div div div ul li span
content: lost

tag: html body text div div div div ul li span
content: stolen

tag: html body text div div div div ul li span
content: spoilt

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 10) Click on 'Spoilt' (or other option). It should then appearalone in the box.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 11) Click on the `Effective From' box and key in the date onwhich you received the vouchers.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 12) Select the 'Reason for Cancellation' from the listprovided. This action will enable the [Save] button.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 13) Click on the [Save] button to store the change.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: 14. This action will result in the display of a final warningmessage confirming that the change of status is irreversible

tag: html body text div div div div ul li span
content: Click on [Yes] to receive the message 'This changehas been saved and the vouchers will be cancelled overnight'.

tag: html body text div div div p span
content: The overnight batch process will update all the voucher andstock on hand records. This will have the effect of reducing theminimum stock level of vouchers held by the subcontractor and,unless there is a system stop on voucher issue, trigger automaticreplenishment.
